informatics  systems  pose  new  interesting  HCI  challenges. We believe that the stage-based model, the identification of

affect  people’s  decisions  about  and  behavior  surrounding 
the  acts  of  selecting  tools,  collecting,  integrating,  and 
reflecting on data, and lapsing and resuming.

developed  the  five-staged  personal  informatics

Personal 
informatics 
informatics  systems  pose  new  interesting  HCI  challenges. We believe that the stage-based model, the identification of 
the  barriers  within  each  stage,  and  the  description  of  the 
properties  of  the  stages  will  help  HCI  researchers  and 
practitioners  find  solutions  and  explore  new  approaches  in 
personal informatics more efficiently.

For personal informatics researchers, the personal informatics 
models  should  be  further  developed  to  account  for  social 
influence.
